text: Sen. Rubio joins the Argentine & Israeli community in commemorating the 26th anniversary of the horrific terrorist attack against the #AMIA in #BuenosAires, #Argentina. We will never forget the victims who were killed by Hezbollah, an Iranian-backed terrorist organization.

ICYMI: My remarks from the @TexasGOP State Convention...

Together, let's defend Texas.

Let's defend the Bill of Rights.

Let's defend Liberty.

Let's defend America!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=nRGbubmw7GE&feature=youtu.be

The Trump administration burying their heads in the sand won’t make coronavirus magically disappear. 

It’s here. It’s real. And unless Republicans grow a spine and stand up to this dangerous decision more Americans will die. 
https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/18/white-house-seeks-to-block-funds-for-testing-in-coronavirus-relief-bill-report.html

Congress must take additional action to weather the damage caused by #COVID19—and we need to get the Phase 4 relief package right. Read about the five key components I believe should be included in the Phase 4 package: https://www.deseret.com/opinion/2020/7/18/21327388/senator-mitt-romney-utah-covid-19-relief-cares-package-stimulus-business-national-debt-unemployment

Eisenhower once said: “Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed.”

It's time to cut the Pentagon budget by 10% and invest in human needs.

RT @RepBonamici Mr. President - You could "help" by sending more PPE and COVID-19 tests, not stormtroopers. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1284831061181173761 QT @realDonaldTrump We are trying to help Portland, not hurt it. Their leadership has, for months, lost control of the anarchists and agitators. They are missing in action. We must protect Federal property, AND OUR PEOPLE. These were not merely protesters, these are the real deal!

Tragic to see such a horrific ending to what was supposed to be a joyful day for friends in law enforcement. Lifting up in my prayers the families of the victims of last night’s accident & the entire Thin Blue Line Law Enforcement Motorcycle Club. https://www.khou.com/amp/article/news/local/texas/3-killed-9-critically-injured-after-crash-involving-thin-blue-line-law-enforcement-motorcycle-club/285-9f7a855a-4e44-49ad-bf01-a1d575bc595e

In recent months 30 million workers have lost their jobs and their income. Many struggle to put food on the table. This week the Senate must pass a bill to fully extend unemployment benefits, provide a $2,000 monthly stipend and guarantee health care for the length of the crisis.

All the nations you have made shall come to bow before you, Lord,and give honor to your name. For you are great and do wondrous deeds; and you alone are God.

Psalms 86: 9-10

RT @legally_blaque Proud to announce that I will be attending Howard University School of Law this fall!

Only 2% of US lawyers are Black women. This is our time to rise up, and lift as we climb. So excited to begin this new journey! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdPOxd2UYAIK1-A.jpg

John Lewis’ legacy isn’t just what he did in the 1960s—his legacy continues today and forward with each new generation. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdTb2w6XkAcr3qj.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1284892714916622336/vid/480x270/_Uz4tVncWeldLVQ3.mp4?tag=13

Twitter is slamming Marco for mistakenly posting the wrong photo.

FWIW, others often confuse Marco & me. People regularly come up to me & say “I love you, Sen. Rubio.” 

I don’t correct them & I’ll take a pic, but as they’re taking it I whisper, “actually, I voted for Cruz.” 🤷🏻‍♂️

Sen. Rubio joined @DeFede on @CBSMiami to discuss the unemployment benefit under the #CARESAct, the Trump Administration’s response to the #COVID19 pandemic, #China’s role in covering up the virus, reopening schools, and more.

Read more and watch🔽
https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/press-releases?ID=03DE4941-D4E2-4404-846D-207747411EF9

The event benefits @PRC_sf and other AIDS organizations in the Bay Area. Watch #AIDSWalkSF here: https://abc7news.com/community-events/watch-sunday-celebs-host-aids-walk-live-at-home/6317185/

Donald Trump is going to spend this election trying to convince us that people aren’t dying and the economy isn’t collapsing because of his failure to lead during this public health crisis. But they are, and it is—and we must elect @JoeBiden in November to turn this around. https://twitter.com/ASlavitt/status/1284675429731893250 QT @ASlavitt If you want to know what happened in the White House that led us to where we are, see this from ⁦@EricLiptonNYT⁩ ⁦@maggieNYT⁩ & others.

The wrong people, making the wrong choices, for the wrong reasons, with the wrong motivations. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/us/politics/trump-coronavirus-response-failure-leadership.html

The pandemic has exacerbated America’s water crisis while impacting communities of color the hardest. 

Read my latest op-ed with @DoloresHuerta on how the fight for safe and affordable water cannot be disentangled from the fight for racial justice.
https://www.mercurynews.com/2020/07/16/7301162/
RT @AyannaPressley Now bring the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act (HR 4) to the Senate Floor for a vote immediately.

This week, the Senate should rename the bill to restore voting rights the John Lewis Voting Rights Act of 2020. And Mitch McConnell should immediately bring it up for a vote to honor the legacy of an American hero.

This is awesome. 

With all the anger & division in the world, this reminds us we are all one. Brothers & sisters, fellow human beings. And the arts can help bring us together. https://twitter.com/bbcworld/status/1284417325375074306 QT @BBCWorld Morgan Bullock is an African-American Irish dancer from Richmond, Virginia

After a TikTok video of her lightning-footed jigs went viral, she was accused of "cultural appropriation"

Then she got a call from Riverdance...💃 https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/world-us-canada-53452080/why-i-fell-in-love-with-irish-dancing http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1284415628397379586/img/b-E51vqsWklSoGdg.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1284415628397379586/vid/320x568/zjVuVPABvRHnleaa.mp4?tag=13

Trump's proposed payroll tax cut would do nothing for the 30 million who lost jobs during the pandemic while taking money away from Social Security.

Instead, we must extend unemployment benefits, provide $2,000 a month to every working-class American, and expand Medicare to all. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1284858118577557506 QT @washingtonpost Trump demands payroll tax cut while GOP eyes benefit cuts for unemployed https://trib.al/wYXa9lh

Tens of millions of Americans have filed for unemployment and this is what the Republicans are offering? Instead, we should extend unemployment benefits, provide $2,000 a month to every American, and expand Medicare to all.
https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/07/19/republican-stimulus-unemployment-coronavirus/

A staggering 70% of the wealth in our country is owned by the top 10% of households while the bottom half owns less than 2%. We need to close this growing wealth gap—Baby Bonds is one way to get this done while also virtually closing the racial wealth gap. https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/06/close-racial-wealth-gap-baby-bonds/613525/

In July, nearly one third of Americans were unable to make their housing payments. We are on the verge of mass evictions for renters and homeowners and Congress must have the urgency to act.
 
I announced my RELIEF Act to help address this looming housing and eviction cliff.
@jbillinson wanna bet?

We have got to transform our priorities. We should not pass a $740 billion defense budget at a time when so many are struggling. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1284127807413657600/img/zSjU2dOdgpL270GG.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1284127807413657600/vid/320x320/1x2xkkyipq504yjS.mp4?tag=13

Too many Americans have died because Donald Trump and his team were too arrogant to listen to the public health experts, too slow to recognize they were wrong, too stubborn to change direction, and too cowardly to take responsibility. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/us/politics/trump-coronavirus-response-failure-leadership.html

The pandemic has created a looming eviction crisis that could leave millions of renters without a roof over their head. Passing my RELIEF Act is one step to ensuring that doesn’t happen. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdVLL22XsAAI3RX.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1285014581828636673/vid/480x270/1dCGBawdR-5T17Vg.mp4?tag=13

RT @MrAndyNgo .@tedwheeler is doing the media rounds where is repeating the talking point that DHS protecting federal property & arresting criminal suspects is a "threat to our democracy." Meanwhile, the Portland mayor has allowed terrorists to riot for weeks—long before DHS came. https://twitter.com/kylegriffin1/status/1284918632552828928 QT @kylegriffin1 Portland mayor on CNN: "What I want to do is raise awareness nationally. This could happen in your city. And what we're seeing is a blatant abuse of police tactics by the federal government, by a Trump admin that's falling in the polls. This is a direct threat to our democracy."

Worth watching. Very important, thoughtful discussion by two Oxford epidemiologists: 

“Lockdown is a blunt tool and there needs to be intelligent conversations about what mitigation strategies can keep society functioning while we keep the most vulnerable shielded.” https://twitter.com/aginnt/status/1284959482544631810 QT @aginnt 4/ “We will be down about where we were with the swine flu: around 0.1-0.3% which is much lower than what we think because at the moment we are seeing the case fatality."

by @freddiesayers

To honor John Lewis’ life and legacy, I’m calling on Mitch McConnell to immediately bring the Voting Rights Advancement Act to the Senate floor for a vote and the Senate should name it the John Lewis Voting Rights Act of 2020.

John Lewis taught us to always ask ourselves what more we can do—for our nation and each other. Never allow complacency, bitterness, or hate to consume us. Lead with love always and don't give up. 

In his honor, we must keep marching toward justice.
https://www.nbcnews.com/know-your-value/feature/karine-jean-pierre-what-we-can-all-learn-rep-john-ncna1234318

USCIS had more than enough time to prepare for new DACA applications. We’re not going to let them drag their feet with this. They must resume accepting DACA applications immediately. https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2020-07-16/trump-refuses-new-daca-supreme-court
